alert.note: Alert for Chase; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 2:10PM CST until December 15 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lincoln and Chase counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on very slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will reduce visibility making travel hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A sharp gradient in snow totals is expected with the highest snow amounts over western Chase and northwestern Lincoln county. Some locally higher snow accumulations above 4 inches are possible in these areas. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Keep in mind, travel to the west of North Platte and Imperial will be difficult to nearly impossible due to blizzard conditions over the Nebraska Panhandle, western Sandhills and northeastern Colorado. &&
